publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-2402Stuart McMillan:Funding to Encourage Green Travel—That the Parliament welcomes the recent Scottish Government announcement that Barrhead, Kirkwall, Dumfries, Dundee, Kirkintilloch/Lenzie, Larbert/Stenhousemuir and Glasgow East End have been chosen to pilot a scheme that is aimed at promoting healthier travel choices, providing more opportunities for cycling and walking and allowing the public to feel the increased benefits of physical activity; notes that the seven local authorities will have a budget of £15 million to spend on sustainable-transport initiatives such as organised cycling and walking trips, car-sharing schemes and better integrated access from rail and bus stations to key points in towns and cities, and further notes that Scotland leads the United Kingdom in its approach to tackling climate change and has set ambitious targets to reduce emissions by 80% by 2050. Supported by: Bashir Ahmad*, Alasdair Allan*, Rob Gibson*, Christina McKelvie*, Bill Kidd*, Roseanna Cunningham*, Gil Paterson*
S3M-2402 Funding to Encourage Green Travel (lodged on 18 August 2008) Bob Doris*
